question: David has 30 hectares of pear field. There are 42 pears per hectare. David can harvest his pears every 2 months. How many pears can David harvest within a year?
answer:
David has 42*30= <<42*30=1260>>1260 pears on his field.
David can harvest his pears 12 / 2 = <<12/2=6>>6 times per year
Therefore David can harvest 1260*6 = <<1260*6=7560>>7560 pears per year.
#### 7560
